text:
When I was configuring a new site and misspelled the path in ScriptAlias the
only error I got in the error-log was:

[Tue Apr 01 09:15:28 2003] [notice] child pid 7722 exit signal Segmentation
fault (11)
[Tue Apr 01 09:15:30 2003] [notice] child pid 7723 exit signal Segmentation
fault (11)
[Tue Apr 01 09:15:33 2003] [notice] child pid 7725 exit signal Segmentation
fault (11)
[Tue Apr 01 09:15:36 2003] [notice] child pid 7726 exit signal Segmentation
fault (11)
[Tue Apr 01 09:15:39 2003] [notice] child pid 7727 exit signal Segmentation
fault (11)
[Tue Apr 01 09:15:42 2003] [notice] child pid 7728 exit signal Segmentation 
fault (11)

The config:
ScriptAlias /cgi-bin/ /var/www/www.exammple.org/cgi-bin/
                                       ^-- The misspellning
ScriptAlias /cgi-bin/ /var/www/www.example.org/cgi-bin/
And it worked.

Took me some time to figure this out :) 
I think that a nicer error than Segmentation fault is needed.
Nothing serious I think (therefore the minor severity).

Thanks for your work!
creator: apache-bugs@stone.nu

text:
which cgi module?  mod_cgi or mod_cgid?

can you post a backtrace for the segfault?

thanks!
creator: trawick@apache.org
